Class DatasetListVerifier

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.InputVerifier
      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.TextFieldInputVerifier
          edu.umaryland.igs.idea.StateDependentInputVerifier
              edu.umaryland.igs.idea.FileVerifier
                  edu.umaryland.igs.idea.FileFormatVerifier
                      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.DatasetListVerifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class DatasetListVerifier
extends FileFormatVerifier

Class DatasetListVerifier is a FileFormatVerifier for the dataset list used in multi-dataset mode. A dataset list should have one sequence filename per line. It may optionally list tree filenames in a second column, separated from the sequence filenames by a tab. Filenames may be either absolute or relative paths, and relative paths may be to files in subdirectories. Individual filenames are validated for length.

Written:

Author:

createDatasetVerifiers

private void createDatasetVerifiers(String datasetListName)
The createDatasetVerifiers method creates the sequence and tree verifiers, which are instances of anonymous subclasses of class DatasetVerifier (defined below) instantiated with the specified dataset list filename. They impose length limits on the sequence and tree filenames, respectively, based on both the current omega values and either the current input directory, the current dataset list filename's location or the directry from which IDEA was invoked.

Parameters:
datasetListName - the name of the dataset list, whose parent directory may be prepended to filenames

verifyText

public boolean verifyText(String text)
Description copied from class: FileFormatVerifier
The verifyText method is declared by TextFieldInputVerifier. FileFormatVerifier's implementation returns false if the entry does not correspond to an existing file if the corresponding file is a directory, unreadable or empty, or if an I/O error occurs while parsing the file. Otherwise, it returns true if every line in the file is found to be valid and false if any line is found to be invalid. Individual lines are validated by calling verify. Since a file may be invalid for a number of distinct reasons, the errorMessage field is set so it can be returned by a later call to errorMessage. Subclasses implementing verify should set errorMessage within that method in the event of failure.

Overrides:
verifyText in class FileFormatVerifier
Parameters:
text - the name of a file whose format is to be validated
Returns:
whether the file exists as a readable, non-empty, non-directory file in the required format and can be parsed without an IOException

verify

public boolean verify(String line,
                      int lineNumber)
Theverify method for DatasetListVerifier returns whether a line in the file is in the expected dataset-list format.

Specified by:
verify in class FileFormatVerifier
Parameters:
line - the line (string) to verify
lineNumber - the number of the line in the file; unused in this subclass
Returns:
whether this line contains a valid sequence file name and a valid tree file name separated by whitespace

errorMessage

String errorMessage(String text)
The errorMessage method is declared by TextFieldInputVerifier. The message returned by DatasetListVerifier's implementation may indicate that a line is improperly formatted or that a sequence or tree filename listed in the file is too long.

Overrides:
errorMessage in class FileFormatVerifier
Parameters:
text - the name of a dataset list file which was found to be invalid
Returns:
an error message explaining which line was the first to be invalid and why
